intro: Palicourea cogolloi, commonly known as the Cogolloi moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Palicourea cogolloi is also valued for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
